alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Inland Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:25AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gulf and south central Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, southwestern Liberty and west central Franklin Counties in Big Bend of Florida through 1215 PM EDT/1115 AM CDT/... At 1125 AM EDT/1025 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Stonemill Creek to 7 miles south of Port St. Joe. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port St. Joe, Stonemill Creek, Orange, Wewahitchka, Honeyville, Chipola Cutoff, Eleven Mile, Odena, Cape San Blas, Indian Pass, Red Hill, Scotts Ferry, Milltown, Estiffanulga, Willis Landing, Chipola Park, Simmons Bayou, Dalkeith, Highland View and Thirteen Mile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
